intro: Verbesina badilloi, commonly known as the Mexican beggar's-ticks, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and have a rough texture, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
